title: North Korea Uncovered, Lighthouses
name: North Korea Uncovered, Lighthouses
description:
This data was taken from a kml file that was downloaded as a csv and sorted to locate lighthouses. The data was then reuploaded as a new csv into Finder!. The data comes from North Korea Uncovered. 

This Google Earth project offers an extensive mapping of North Korea's economic, cultural, political, and military infrastructures. Through the topic menu, users of this program have easy access to geographical information on North Korea's agriculture projects, aviation facilities, communications, hospitals, hotels, energy infrastructure, financial services, leisure destinations, manufacturing facilities, markets, mines, religious locations, restaurants, schools, and transportation infrastructure. In addition to locations of economic interest, this map also displays anti-aircraft locations, the Demilitarized Zone (DMZ) and Northern Line Limit Line (NLL), incarceration facilities, political monuments, political residencies, military bases, and nuclear facilities.

properties.name: Ansong Gap Lighthouse
properties.description: Date unknown. Active; focal plane 87 m (285 ft); one long white flash every 7 s. 7.5 m (25 ft) hexagonal concrete tower, painted white. Located on a very prominent cape about 16 km (10 mi) southwest of Hongwon and a similar distance northeast of Hungnam. Site and tower closed. ARLHS NKR-015; Admiralty M4506.5; NGA 16308.5.

properties.name: Apryong Dan Lighthouse
properties.description:
http://www.unc.edu/~rowlett/lighthouse/prk.htm
http://www.leuchtturm-welt.net/HTML/LTPHILA/ORIGINAL/NKO04_4.JPG

Date unknown. Active; focal plane unknown; white flash every 10 s. Approx. 10 m (33 ft) round concrete tower with lantern and gallery. The lighthouse appears to be unpainted white concrete. No photo available, but Klaus Huelse has a postage stamp image. Located on a prominent cape about 25 km (15 mi) east of Wonsan. Site and tower closed. Admiralty M4473; NGA 16350.

properties.name: Chamae Do (Jamaedo, Jame Do) Lighthouse
properties.description:
http://www.lighthousedepot.com/lite_explorer.asp?action=display_details&LighthouseID=4121

1917. Active; focal plane 43 m (138 ft); white flash every 18 s. 9.5 m (31 ft) round concrete tower with lantern and gallery, painted white. A postage stamp image is at right. Located on an islet northwest of Sok Do about 16 km (10 mi) west of the Taedong River entrance. Site and tower closed. ARLHS NKR-002(=011); Admiralty M4118; NGA 18116.

properties.name: Changadae Dan Lighthouse
properties.description: Date unknown. Active; focal plane 75 m (246 ft); two white flashes every 18 s. 14 m (46 ft) octagonal concrete tower with lantern and gallery. Entire lighthouse is white. Located on a prominent cape about 8 km (5 mi) northwest of Kosong. Site and tower closed. ARLHS NKR-001; Admiralty M4462; NGA 16359.

properties.name: Changdok Do (Wonsan Hang) Lighthouse
properties.description:
http://www.leuchtturm-welt.net/HTML/LTPHILA/ORIGINAL/NKO04_3.JPG

Date unknown. Active; focal plane 25 m (82 ft); white flash every 5.5 s. Approx. 12 m (39 ft) slender square skeletal tower mounted atop a round concrete tower with lantern. The lower tower appears to be unpainted white concrete. No photo available, but Klaus Huelse has a postage stamp image (above)  Located on a skerry at the end of the 1.2 km (3/4mi) long breakwater of Wonsan. Accessible only by boat. Site and tower closed. Admiralty M4480; NGA 16340.

properties.name: Huibong Gang (Cho Do) Lighthouse
properties.description: Date unknown. Active; focal plane 36 m (118 ft); white flash every 3 s. 8.5 m (28 ft) octagonal concrete tower, rising from a 1-story keeper's house. Located at the southeastern tip of Cho Do, marking the strait between the island and the mainland. Site and tower closed. NGA 18118.5.

properties.name: Ijin Man (Oryong Am) Lighthouse
properties.description: 1916. Active; focal plane 18 m (59 ft); two white flashes every 6 s. 16.5 m (54 ft) round concrete tower, painted black. No photo available. Located on a rock south of Ijin - ri. Accessible only by boat. Site and tower closed. ARLHS NKR-017; Admiralty M4556; NGA 16248.

properties.name: Komalsan Lighthouse
properties.description:
http://www.lighthousedepot.com/lite_explorer.asp?action=display_details&LighthouseID=4122

1910. Active; focal plane 59 m (194 ft); one long white flash every 6 s. 14 m (46 ft) square cylindrical concrete tower with lantern and gallery, centered on a 1-story concrete keeper's house. Entire lighthouse is white. Fog siren (blast every 45 s). Google has a satellite view in which the light station appears very little changed from its historic appearance. Located at the tip of a peninsula on the east side of the city of Chongjin. Site and tower closed. ARLHS NKR-012; Admiralty M4540; NGA 16252.

properties.name: Kwangsungotchi Lighthouse
properties.description: Date unknown. Active; focal plane 46 m (151 ft); one long white flash every 9 s. Tower height unknown. Located on a promontory about 20 km (13 mi) east of Kumya. Site and tower closed. Admiralty M4490; NGA 16323.

properties.name: Maan Do Lighthouse
properties.description: Date unknown. Active; focal plane 72 m (236 ft); white flash every 5 s. 8 m (26 ft) round brick tower, painted white. Located at the southwestern tip of Sin Do, a large island in the mouth of the Yalu River, marking the river entrance. Site and tower closed. ARLHS NKR-027; Admiralty M4100; NGA 18176.

properties.name: Mayangdo (Bayo To) Lighthouse
properties.description: 1913. Active; focal plane 68 m (223 ft); four white flashes every 22 s. 8 m (26 ft) octagonal concrete tower with lantern and gallery, painted white. Mayang Do is an irregularly-shaped island about 6 km (3.5 mi) long located just off the coast about 20 km (13 mi) east of Hongwon. Located on a hill near the southeastern point of the island. Site and tower closed. ARLHS NKR-019; Admiralty M4510; NGA 16308.

properties.name: Musudan Lighthouse
properties.description: 1911. Active; focal plane 83 m (272 ft); two white flashes every 15 s. 8.5 m (28 ft) round concrete tower with lantern and gallery, painted white. Keeper's house and other buildings. Fog siren. No photo available, but Google has a satellite view. Located on the most prominent cape of Korea's northeast coast, near the village of Kalma. Site and tower closed. ARLHS NKR-020; Admiralty M4530; NGA 16280.

properties.name: Nando Lighthouse
properties.description:
http://www.lighthousedepot.com/lite_explorer.asp?action=display_details&LighthouseID=4123

1915. Active; focal plane 42 m (138 ft); white flash every 14 s. 11 m (36 ft) square cylindrical concrete tower with lantern and gallery, rising from a 1-story concrete keeper's house. Entire lighthouse is white. Fog siren. A postage stamp image is at right. This is Korea's northernmost lighthouse. Located on a small island in the Sea of Japan about 15 km (9 mi) southeast of Sonbong, near the Russian border. Accessible only by boat. Site and tower closed. ARLHS NKR-003; Admiralty M4570; NGA 16200.

properties.name: North Phyongan Provincial Nautical Mark Station (Suun Do Lighthouse)
properties.description:
http://www.kcckp.net/en/periodic/korea/index.php?contents+1182+2005-10+44+15

http://www.lighthousedepot.com/lite_explorer.asp?action=display_details&LighthouseID=4128

1909. Active; focal plane 48 m (157 ft); white flash every 10 s. 8 m (26 ft) round cylindrical concrete tower with lantern and gallery, attached to a 1-story concrete keeper's house. Entire lighthouse is white. Suun Do is the westernmost in a chain of half a dozen small islands about 20 km (13 mi) southeast of the Yalu River entrance. Located on the highest point of the island. Site and tower closed. ARLHS NKR-007; Admiralty M4104; NGA 18160.

properties.name: Orangdan Lighthouse
properties.description: Date unknown. Active; focal plane 46 m (151 ft); white light, 2 s on, 2 s off. 8.5 m (28 ft) round brick tower, painted white. Fog siren. No photo available. Located on a promontory on the east side of the port of Odaejin. Site and tower closed. ARLHS NKR-021; Admiralty M4534; NGA 16272.

properties.name: Oripo-ri Lighthouse
properties.description: Date unknown. Active; focal plane 36 m (118 ft); continuous white light. 7 m (23 ft) white concrete tower. Located on a promontory on the south side of the Taedong estuary about 5 km (3 mi) southeast of the P'i Do lighthouse. Site and tower closed. Admiralty M4128; NGA 18136.

properties.name: P'i Do Lighthouse
properties.description:
Around 1986 (station established 1905). Active; focal plane 86 m (282 ft); two white flashes every 3 s. 33 m (108 ft) square pyramidal masonry tower with lantern and gallery, centered on a large 1-story masonry administration building. This is North Korea's tallest and most powerful lighthouse. The light marks the actual entrance to the Taedong River and the port of Nampo. Since 1986 the entrance has been closed by the West Sea Barrage (Nampo Dam), a dam about 8 km (5 mi) long. Ships enter and leave the river through locks at the extreme south end of the barrage, between the island of P'i Do and the south bank. The lighthouse is built on the highest point of P'i Do. Site and tower closed. ARLHS NKR-004; Admiralty M4126; NGA 18132. 

2008 photo:
http://www.flickr.com/photos/mytripsmypics/2454043541/

Original Lighthouse:
http://www.lighthousedepot.com/lite_explorer.asp?action=display_details&LighthouseID=4125

properties.name: Pibal do Lighthouse
properties.description:
http://www.lighthousedepot.com/lite_explorer.asp?action=display_details&LighthouseID=4124

1909 (possibly rebuilt after the Korean War). Active; focal plane 26 m (85 ft); white flash every 9 s. 11 m (36 ft) multistage tower: a skeletal tower is mounted on a round metal equipment room atop a hexagonal concrete base. Entire lighthouse is white. The lighthouse is built on a volcanic rock connected to the mainland by a footbridge. Located in the center of the harbor of Nampo, on the north side of the Taedong River. Site and tower closed. ARLHS NKR-013; Admiralty M4132; NGA 18148.

properties.name: So Do Lighthouse
properties.description:
http://www.lighthousedepot.com/lite_explorer.asp?action=display_details&LighthouseID=4126&bhcd2=1238207123

1908. Active; focal plane 94 m (308 ft); white flash every 20 s. 9.5 m (31 ft) round concrete tower with lantern and gallery, painted white. The lighthouse marks the southern entrance to Taedong Gang (bay). Located on an islet off the west end of Cho Do, about 30 km (19 mi) southwest of the river entrance. Site and tower closed. ARLHS NKR-005; Admiralty M4116; NGA 18112.

properties.name: Soho (Sohojin) Lighthouse
properties.description:
http://www.lighthousedepot.com/lite_explorer.asp?action=display_details&LighthouseID=4127

1911. Active; focal plane 49 m (161 ft); two white flashes every 30 s. 7 m (23 ft) octagonal concrete tower centered on a square 1-story concrete keeper's house. Entire lighthouse is white. A postage stamp image is at right, and Google has a fuzzy satellite view. Located at the tip of a rugged peninsula on the east side of the port of Hungnam. Site and tower closed. ARLHS NKR-014; Admiralty M4506; NGA 16312.

properties.name: Sokkun Som
properties.description: Date unknown (station established 1919). Active; focal plane 25 m (82 ft); white flash every 7 s. 17 m (56 ft) 2-stage round strongly conical concrete tower with a gallery at the top of the lower stage. The lighthouse appears to be unpainted white concrete. Klaus Huelse has a postage stamp image (http://www.leuchtturm-welt.net/HTML/LTPHILA/ORIGINAL/NKO04_1.JPG). Located on a skerry about 1 km (0.6 mi) off the southern tip of the Hodo Peninsula, marking the entrance to Tonhan Bay; Accessible only by boat. Site and tower closed. ARLHS NKR-006; Admiralty M4488; NGA 16324.

properties.name: Songjin  Peninsula Lighthouse
properties.description: Date unknown. Active; focal plane 55 m (180 ft); white light, 3 s on, 3 s off. 7.5 m (25 ft) octagonal concrete tower, painted white. No photo available. Located on a promontory on the south side of the port of Kimchaek. Site and tower closed. Admiralty M4516; NGA 16284.

properties.name: Suwon Dan Lighthouse
properties.description: Date unknown (station established 1906). Active; focal plane 41 m (134 ft); two white flashes every 15 s. 17 m (56 ft) octagonal concrete tower with lantern and gallery. Entire lighthouse is white. Fog siren (blast every 60 s). No photo available. Located on a cape about 3 km (2 mi) east of Kosong and 6 km (3.5 mi) north of the Demilitarized Zone separating the two Koreas. Site and tower closed. ARLHS NKR-008; Admiralty M4461; NGA 16364.

properties.name: Teahwa Do Lighthouse
properties.description: 1909. Active; focal plane 95 m (312 ft); white flash every 20 s. 24 m (79 ft) hexagonal cast iron skeletal tower, painted white. No photo available. Taehwa Do is an island in Korea Bay about 50 km (30 mi) southeast of the Yalu River entrance. Located on the south side of the island. Site and tower closed. ARLHS NKR-030; Admiralty M4112; NGA 18156.

properties.name: Toechodo Lighthouse
properties.description:
http://www.lighthousedepot.com/lite_explorer.asp?action=display_details&LighthouseID=4129

1935. Active; focal plane 120 m (394 ft); four white flashes every 25 s. 12.5 m (41 ft) square cylindrical concrete tower with lantern and gallery, rising from a 1-story concrete keeper's house. Entire lighthouse is white. Fog siren (blast every 45 s). Taecho Do is an inhabited island roughly 1.5 km (1 mi) in diameter about 8 km (5 mi) south of Rajin. Located at the southern tip of the island. Site and tower closed. ARLHS NKR-010; Admiralty M4558; NGA 16232.

properties.name: Un Do Lighthouse
properties.description:
http://www.leuchtturm-welt.net/HTML/LTPHILA/ORIGINAL/NKO04_2.JPG

Date unknown. Active; focal plane 25 m (82 ft); two white flashes every 6 s. 7 m (23 ft) square concrete tower, probably with lantern and gallery and attached to a small equipment building. Entire lighthouse is white. Huelse has a postage stamp image, identified as Yubundo, that might depict this lighthouse. Located on an islet about 13 km (8 mi) southeast of the Yalu River entrance. Located on the highest point of the island. Site and tower closed. ARLHS NKR-031; Admiralty M4105; NGA 18164.

properties.name: Yodo Lighthouse
properties.description: 1906. Active; focal plane 67 m (220 ft); white light occulting once every 20 s. 8 m (26 ft) octagonal concrete tower, painted white. No photo available. Yo Do is the largest of a scattering on small islands in the entrance to Tonhan Bay. Located on the highest point of the island. Accessible only by boat. Site and tower closed. ARLHS NKR-023; Admiralty M4472; NGA 16332.

properties.name: Yongjin Lighthouse
properties.description: Date unknown. Active; focal plane 65 m (213 ft); one long white flash every 12 s. Tower height unknown. NGA describes this as a "white square framework tower," but Google's satellite view is consistent with a concrete tower. Located on a promontory on the north side of Tonhan Bay. Site and tower closed. Admiralty M4485; NGA 16326.
